toxicity_level.status: EXTREMELY TOXIC - ONE OF MOST POISONOUS PLANTS

handling_precautions: Berries look attractive but are deadly
Even handling can cause absorption through skin
Wash hands thoroughly after any contact

primary_toxins.name: Atropine
primary_toxins.mechanism: Competitive antagonist of muscarinic acetylcholine receptors; blocks parasympathetic nervous system
primary_toxins.lethal_dose: 10-20 berries can kill an adult; 2-5 berries can kill a child

primary_toxins.name: Scopolamine
primary_toxins.mechanism: Similar to atropine; crosses blood-brain barrier more readily causing delirium
primary_toxins.lethal_dose: Present in lower concentrations but highly toxic

symptoms_by_severity.description: dry mouth, dilated pupils, flushed skin, rapid heartbeat
hallucinations, delirium, agitation, inability to urinate

fatality_note: Many documented fatalities throughout history. Berries taste sweet, making them especially dangerous to children.
first_aid_immediate: Note time of ingestion and amount if known
first_aid_medical: Physostigmine as antidote (under medical supervision only)
antidote: Physostigmine salicylate (must be given by medical professionals)
medical_treatment: ICU care, physostigmine, benzodiazepines for seizures, cooling measures
long_term_effects: Survivors may have memory problems; most recover fully with treatment
storage_risks: All parts remain toxic when dried
processing_risks: Pharmaceutical use only under strict controls
contraindications: ALL USE - THIS PLANT IS DEADLY POISON
